element.groupDescription: This group contains functions related to single media server

element.name: execAction
element.description: Execute business action. Action data should bin in a internal binary format. This method is going to be refactor at next version.
element.result: Return XML with 'OK' message or error code

element.name: events
from
element.description: Start of time period at ms since 1.1.1970 (UTC format).

element.name: to
element.description: End of time period at ms since 1.1.1970 (UTC format).

element.result: Return media server event log in proprietary binary format

element.name: cameraAvailability
element.description: Checks if camera is accessible from media server

element.name: mediaStreamAvailability
element.description: Checks if camera media stream can be opened

element.name: setCameraParam
element.description: Sets values of several camera parameters. This parameters are used on a advanced Tab in camera settings. For instance: brigthness, contrast e.t.c.

element.name: <any name>
element.description: Parameter for camera to set. Request can contains one or more parameters to set.

element.result: Returns OK if all parameters have been set, otherwise returns error 500 (Internal server error) and result of setting for every param.

element.name: getCameraParam
element.description: Read camera parameters. For instance: brigthness, contrast e.t.c. Parameters to read should be specified.

element.name: <any name>
element.description: Parameter name to read. Request can contains one or more parameters.

element.result: Returns required parameter values in form of paramName=paramValue, each param on new line

element.name: time
element.description: required image time. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. Date format is auto detected. Also, addition special values are allowed.

element.name: NOW
element.description: Live position (no frame is returned if camera is offline

element.name: LATEST
element.description: last frame from camera (return live position or last frame from archive if camera is offline)

element.name: method
element.description: Parameter defines method to search frame inside GOP structure. Default value 'before'. Parameter not used for Motion jpeg video codec.

element.name: before
element.description: Returns nearest I-frame before specified time.

element.name: after
element.description: Returns nearest I-frame after specified time.

element.name: exact
element.description: Get image for exact time position. It required more CPU.

element.name: height
element.description: Required image height. By default image have same size as source video stream.

element.name: width
element.description: Required image width. By default image have same size as source video stream. If only width or height is specified other parameter is auto detected. Video aspect ratio is not changed.

element.name: showLog
element.description: Returns tail of the server log file
element.result: Tail of the server log file in text format

element.name: manualCamera/search
start_ip
element.description: First ip address in range to scan.

element.name: end_ip
element.description: Last ip address in range to scan.

element.name: port
element.description: Camera(s) port to chek. Port is autodetected if parameter is absent.

element.result: XML with camera names, manufacturers and urls.

element.name: manualCamera/stop
element.result: XML with OK message or error code.

element.name: manualCamera/add
element.description: Manual add camera(s). If several cameras are added, parameters 'url' and 'manufacturer' must be defined several times.

element.name: url
element.description: Camera url returned by scan request.

element.result: XML with OK message or error code.

element.name: ptz/move
element.result: XML with OK message or error code.

element.name: ptz/stop
element.result: XML with OK message or error code.

element.name: ptz/moveTo
xPos
element.description: Go to absolute X position in range [-1..+1]

element.name: yPos
element.description: Go to absolute Y position in range [-1..+1]

element.name: zoomPos
element.description: Go to absolute zoom position in range [-1..+1]

element.result: XML with OK message or error code.

element.name: ptz/getPosition
element.result: XML with camera position or error code.

element.name: ptz/calibrate
element.result: XML with OK message or error code.

element.name: ptz/getSpaceMapper
element.description: return JSON-serialized PTZ space mapper. This information contains curves for camera FOV and zoom position and camera moving ranges. This information used in advanced PTZ mode.

element.name: rebuildArchive
element.description: Start or stop rebuilding of media server archive.
element.result: Rebuild progress if no input param specified or XML with OK message or error code.

element.name: RecordedTimePeriods
element.description: Recorded chunk info by specified cameras.

element.name: physicalId
element.description: Camera unique ID. Parameter can be used several times to define a list of cameras.

element.name: startTime
element.description: Start time of a time interval. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. format is auto detected.

element.name: endTime
element.description: End time of a time interval. Microseconds since 1970 UTC or string in format 'YYYY-MM-DDThh24:mi:ss.zzz'. format is auto detected.

element.name: motionRegions
element.description: Match motion on a video by specified rect. Parameter can be used several times.

element.name: format
element.description: Data format. Allowed values: 'json', 'xml', 'txt', 'bin'. Default value 'json'

element.name: detail
element.description: Chunk detail level, in microseconds. Time periods/chunks that are shorter than the detail level are discarded. You can use detail level as amount of microseconds per screen pixel.

element.result: Chunks data in requested format. Chunks are merged for all requested cameras. Time and duration defined in UTC milliseconds.

element.name: statistics
element.description: Returns server info: CPU usage, HDD usage e.t.c.

element.name: storageSpace
element.description: Returns a list of all server storages.

element.name: storageStatus
element.description: Check if specified folder can be used as media server storage.
element.result: JSON data. 'OK' if specified folder may be used for writing on mediaServer. Otherwise returns 'FAIL'

element.name: gettime
element.description: Returns server UTC time and time zone

element.name: installUpdate
element.description: Updates server by the package contained in POST body

element.name: onEvent
element.description: Process business event from external system. Reserved for future use.

element.groupDescription: This group contains functions related to whole system (all media servers).

element.name: getResourceTypes
element.description: Read all resource types. Resource type contain object type such as 'Server', 'Camera' e.t.c. Also, reosource types contain addition information for cameras such as maximum fps, resolution e.t.c

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: getResourceParams
element.description: Read resource (camera, user or server) addition parameters (camera firmware version e.t.c). List of parameters depends of resource type.

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: getCameraHistoryList
element.description: Read information about which server hold camera in some time period. This information is used for archive play if camera was moved from one media server to another.

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: getUserList
element.description: Return users registered in the system. User's password contain MD5 hash data with salt

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: listDirectory
element.description: Return list of folders and files in a virtual FS stored inside database. This function is used to add files (such audio for nitifications) to database.

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: folder
element.description: Folder name in a virtual FS

element.name: getStoredFile
element.description: Read file data from a virtual FS

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: getStoredFile
element.description: Read file data from a virtual FS

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: getSettings
element.description: Read general system settings such as email address e.t.c

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: getAllDataList
element.description: Read all data such as all media servers, cameras, users e.t.c

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided

element.name: csv
element.description: CVS data format. In case of hierarchical data only top level data will be provided
